intro: Plagiobothrys mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are generally basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Plagiobothrys mexicanus is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
